intro: Hoffmannseggia jamesii, commonly known as the James's Hoffmannseggia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and related succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its cylindrical stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Hoffmannseggia jamesii typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
